intro: Hieracium prantlii, commonly known as the Prairie Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America, particularly found in prairie habitats. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium prantlii is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
